name: F.J. Huegel
description:
F. J. Huegel (1889 - 1971)
Listen to freely downloadable audio sermons by the speaker F. J. Huegel in mp3 format.  Was a chaplain in WWI and a missionary in Mexico. He wrote many books that are worth reading. Huegel's writings on the deeper aspects of Christ's work on Calvary and it's implications for the believer have blessed multitudes of Christians. This biography is written by his son, who states in his preface that he has deliberately tried not to present his father's life through rose colored glasses but rather give a true and accurate account--warts and all. Those who have benefited from Huegel's other writings will welcome this unique chance to get a look at the man behind the books. Highly recommended!
He is the author of the book: "Bone of His Bone": One of the most basic principles for a successful life as a Christian is that the individual must experience full dependency on Jesus--allow Christ to become part of him. In effect he must become Bone of His Bone. Don't miss these freshly edited studies on the indwelling Christ.

audio_sermons.title: Great Prayers of History
audio_sermons.description: F. J. Heugel traces through the most significant prayers of mankind, starting with Moses and on through David, Ezra, Daniel, Jesus and Paul.  'Prayers are still making history,' he asserts, pointing to answered prayer in World War I of the British capturing Jerusalem and how in World War II 'God was at Dunkirk' in response to a national day of prayer.  'It isn't prayer,' Heugel reminds us, 'it's the prayer-hearing God.'

audio_sermons.title: The Laws of Prayer
audio_sermons.description: F. J. Heugel expounds about 4 basic 'laws' of prayer, such as the will of God and the law of faith.  By 'law' he means characteristics or 'the realm of spiritual order' that govern prayer.  '[Even] grace has its mold of operation,' he said.  The practical, straight forward teaching from God's Word is wonderfully illustrated by answered prayers from the likes of George Muller, Watchman Nee and others.  (Part 1: The Laws of Prayer / Part 2: The Ministry of Prayer / Part 3: Great Prayers of History)

audio_sermons.title: The Ministry of Prayer
audio_sermons.description: 'Is it not true that when we bow the knee to call upon the Lord,' says Heugel, ' our capacity for good is multiplied a hundred thousand times?'  Heugel believes that intercession is the greatest of all ministries, backing up his assertion with Scripture and example, both historical and personal.  He recounted the flame of intercession of the Moravians from which dawned the great movement of worldwide missions and strengthened his position upon great answers to prayer in the lives of Hudson Taylor, C. T. Studd and others.  (Part 1: The Laws of Prayer / Part 2: The Ministry of Prayer / Part 3: Great Prayers of History)

audio_sermons.title: What Time is it? Christ's Coming
audio_sermons.description: This message speaks of the closeness of Christ's second coming. 'It is very late in the history of mankind.'
